page.title: 16CHANGING FASHIONS IN BALBY
page.content: I am a 9 year old pupil at Woodfield First School. When Mrs. Shorthose aged 69 visited the school I asked her if fashions had changed very much since she was young. She laughed and said, "fashions come and go sometimes in a full circle. The simple 'T' shirts you wear were called chemises in my day." She said that the greatest difference was in the materials. She wore only natural fibres: wool, cotton or linen. She had a best silk dress. She said that washday was a real headache in her youth: no washing machine, no drier, no washing powders, just elbow grease and soap. Modern materials make cleanliness so much easier. She also said that she wore soft leather boots buttoned at the side or front to above her ankles. A button hook was used to fasten these.Her life style was different.
